revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-19 01:09:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/db/test_archive.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api/client.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Reverse sort tables before archiving

sqlalchemy metadata provides a way to sort tables based on foreign
key dependency relationships and then we can reverse sort those to
process leaf nodes first when archiving deleted records. Use this
to at least attempt to archive things in a sane order.

Adds a functional test to cover this since the unit tests for archive
are setup in such a way that they don't stress many of the tables
related to a created instance record and thus miss some fundamental
referential constraint failures during archive.

This does not completely fix archive_deleted_rows because of the issue
with instance_actions not being soft deleted when instances are deleted,
which we still need to sort out, but this at least gives us a functional
test that stresses a real usage of the DB API. And since the tables are
now sorted we can reliably assert the archive results.

Partial-Bug: #1183523

Change-Id: I948b149239f01cca2d4156611bb883580a216a83
"}]
commit_message:
Reverse sort tables before archiving

sqlalchemy metadata provides a way to sort tables based on foreign
key dependency relationships and then we can reverse sort those to
process leaf nodes first when archiving deleted records. Use this
to at least attempt to archive things in a sane order.

Adds a functional test to cover this since the unit tests for archive
are setup in such a way that they don't stress many of the tables
related to a created instance record and thus miss some fundamental
referential constraint failures during archive.

This does not completely fix archive_deleted_rows because of the issue
with instance_actions not being soft deleted when instances are deleted,
which we still need to sort out, but this at least gives us a functional
test that stresses a real usage of the DB API. And since the tables are
now sorted we can reliably assert the archive results.

Partial-Bug: #1183523

Change-Id: I948b149239f01cca2d4156611bb883580a216a83

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-16 23:17:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Clean up legacy multi-version test constructs

This removes MyObj2 and MyObjDiffVers from the tests, and fixes up the
tests that still use them to use the more modern manifest-based approach,
which is much cleaner and doesn't require strangely subclassed objects
to mimic the multi-version environment during an upgrade.

It also removes a few tests that still do some basic validation on the
object registry, which is now fully contained (and tested) inside of
oslo.versionedobjects.

Change-Id: Ia523f3264b0ea54573e54c258efd7a07158ded36
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up legacy multi-version test constructs

This removes MyObj2 and MyObjDiffVers from the tests, and fixes up the
tests that still use them to use the more modern manifest-based approach,
which is much cleaner and doesn't require strangely subclassed objects
to mimic the multi-version environment during an upgrade.

It also removes a few tests that still do some basic validation on the
object registry, which is now fully contained (and tested) inside of
oslo.versionedobjects.

Change-Id: Ia523f3264b0ea54573e54c258efd7a07158ded36

commit_message:
Mark set-admin-password as complete for libvirt in support matrix

The set-admin-password virt driver API was implemented for libvirt
qemu/kvm x86 in liberty per 520a6b92853cf0f6ef183df78c41c70ee0b8cfab but
the hypervisor support matrix wasn't updated.

This updates the support matrix and also adds notes that libvirt 1.2.16
is required along with hw_qemu_guest_agent configuration in the backing
image.

Closes-Bug: #1511114

Change-Id: Iee1d628116cad8c0c60c8335a2910b3c4e1b5e2d

commit_message:
Use idp_id and protocol_id in jsonhome

These are inconsistent with the rest of the federation routes. Note that
this doesn't change a public interface, it changes the path variables
names that exist within a jsonhome document which should only be
referenced within the same href_vars element and some internal variable
names.

Change-Id: I36d41e95d745bd98d36c3442bd4aa4faa91cab72
Closes-Bug: #1420125

subject: Data Security Enforcements In Nova
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-03 00:13:58.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/data-security-enforcements.rst'], 'message': 'Data Security Enforcements In Nova

Enterprises need to be compliant with data security laws and regulations that
require sensitive data to be encrypted at rest (storage) as well in motion
(over the wire). Nova has features such as transparent data encryption that
can be utilized as part of a data security compliance plan. We propose
implementing checks inside Nova that will ensure that such features are
enabled. These checks will be triggered based on the presence of specific
metadata defined on an image. Such declaration based enforcements can provide
additional confidence to the operators tasked with setting up a secure cloud
and thereby provide impetus to the enterprise adoption of OpenStack.

Change-Id: I0618bf381d1868af7facf991d22e2e8113794193
'}]
commit_message:
Data Security Enforcements In Nova

Enterprises need to be compliant with data security laws and regulations that
require sensitive data to be encrypted at rest (storage) as well in motion
(over the wire). Nova has features such as transparent data encryption that
can be utilized as part of a data security compliance plan. We propose
implementing checks inside Nova that will ensure that such features are
enabled. These checks will be triggered based on the presence of specific
metadata defined on an image. Such declaration based enforcements can provide
additional confidence to the operators tasked with setting up a secure cloud
and thereby provide impetus to the enterprise adoption of OpenStack.

Change-Id: I0618bf381d1868af7facf991d22e2e8113794193

subject: Improve support for REMOTE_OPERATIONS in manual runs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-04 15:58:16.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/create-nodes', 'scripts/install-dependencies', 'scripts/setup-network', 'scripts/configure-vm', 'scripts/get-vm-mac', 'scripts/boot-seed-vm', 'scripts/setup-seed-vm'], 'message': 'Improve support for REMOTE_OPERATIONS in manual runs

This submission applies a number of small changes which made me
to complete successully the build of a seed VM using the
REMOTE_OPERATIONS parameter set to "1" (that is, devtest running
on a distinct host with remote access to libvirtd).

A few notes about the changes:
 * uniforms checks for REMOTE_OPERATIONS using -n rather than != 1
 * removes occurrences of 'sudo virsh' which would not honour the
   user (devtest) defined LIBVIRT_DEFAULT_URI parameter
 * skips chattr +C when images are not available locally

Change-Id: Ib2ce2926fe02a0f5f370a81495cfc192db8b3427
'}]
commit_message:
Improve support for REMOTE_OPERATIONS in manual runs

This submission applies a number of small changes which made me
to complete successully the build of a seed VM using the
REMOTE_OPERATIONS parameter set to "1" (that is, devtest running
on a distinct host with remote access to libvirtd).

A few notes about the changes:
 * uniforms checks for REMOTE_OPERATIONS using -n rather than != 1
 * removes occurrences of 'sudo virsh' which would not honour the
   user (devtest) defined LIBVIRT_DEFAULT_URI parameter
 * skips chattr +C when images are not available locally

Change-Id: Ib2ce2926fe02a0f5f370a81495cfc192db8b3427

commit_message:

In os-cloud-config public is preferred to host if passed so this
change avoids us passing public.

subject: Remove file locks from drivers to support HA A/A
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-21 10:49:11.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/ha-aa-drivers_locks.rst'], 'message': 'Remove file locks from drivers to support HA A/A

This spec outlines work needed for volume nodes to remove local file
locks from Storage Drivers so syncrhonization is possible among Volume
nodes.

This is one of the aspects that are needed to support Active/Active in
cinder.

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I3b94d3bce4c61a344cac073f5f0eafc5a70d233f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove file locks from drivers to support HA A/A

This spec outlines work needed for volume nodes to remove local file
locks from Storage Drivers so syncrhonization is possible among Volume
nodes.

This is one of the aspects that are needed to support Active/Active in
cinder.

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I3b94d3bce4c61a344cac073f5f0eafc5a70d233f

Use standard credential_id parameter in jsonhome

The EC2 jsonhome credential_id is referenced as a parameter unique to
EC2. This is actually just the standard credential_id parameter that
keystone core uses.

commit_message:
Disable DevStack/Tempest runs

Some config options were renamed in tempest, which our Kilo
devstack/tempest code relies on. Update these to the new
names, but that's still not enough. Disable these tests
on Kilo until we can figure this out.

Change-Id: I41f30ab24bffa60444f2cd42dc15c583edc91953

This change adds an 'update' directory within 'environments' were we
can store additional environment files to be optionally used for an
update.

documenting when is appropriate to use it.

subject: Python3-readiness for antlr3 pieces
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-20 02:49:27.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datalog/Python2/CongressLexer.py', 'congress/datalog/Python2/CongressParser.py', 'congress/datalog/compile.py', 'congress/datalog/Python2/__init__.py', 'thirdparty/antlr3-antlr-3.5/runtime/Python3/antlr3/recognizers.py', 'congress/datalog/Python3/CongressLexer.py', 'setup.py', 'congress/datalog/Python3/CongressParser.py', 'antlr3', 'congress/datalog/Python3/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Python3-readiness for antlr3 pieces

Purpose: Make antlr code Python3-ready while keeping Python2 support

Changes:
- Generated Python3 CongressParser.py and CongressLexer.py placed in
subpackage congress/datalog/Python3/ (using antlr 3.5.2)
- Moved original CongressParser.py and CongressLexer.py into new
subpackage congress/datalog/Python2/
- Changed import section in congress/datalog/compiler.py to import
the appropriate subpackage based on python version used
- Removed original symlink antlr3 to the antlr3-python2 runtime
- Changed setup.py to create the appropriate antlr3 symlink based on
python version
- Changed the error reporting interface of antlr3-python3 runtime to
be compatible with what existing Congress code expects
(thirdparty/antlr3-antlr-3.5/runtime/Python3/antlr3/recognizers.py)

Result: tox -e py34 no longer reports any errors traced to antlr code.

Notes:
- Supporting both Python versions was not straightforward because
neither the antlr runtime nor the antlr generated code is
cross-version compatible.
- Making symlinks via setup.py is not ideal, but the best solution
I came up with among several I considered. If you have better ideas
please suggest.
- Making our own custom changes to antlr3-python3 runtime is not
ideal, but it was necessary because for some reason the
antlr3-python3 runtime broke error reporting interface compatibility
with antlr3-python2 runtime, leading to test failures in
test_compile.py and test_congress.py.
In theory, supporting our custom changes in antlr3 runtime bad, but
because antlr3 is not supported anyway, the situation is really no
worse than before. In addition, the changes are fairly minor.
- antlr4 was not adopted because it does not have support for
abstract syntax trees.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3

Change-Id: I376aee803c4dc9953c1b5ba9311cf9c4a42f3319
'}]
commit_message:
Python3-readiness for antlr3 pieces

Purpose: Make antlr code Python3-ready while keeping Python2 support

Changes:
- Generated Python3 CongressParser.py and CongressLexer.py placed in
subpackage congress/datalog/Python3/ (using antlr 3.5.2)
- Moved original CongressParser.py and CongressLexer.py into new
subpackage congress/datalog/Python2/
- Changed import section in congress/datalog/compiler.py to import
the appropriate subpackage based on python version used
- Removed original symlink antlr3 to the antlr3-python2 runtime
- Changed setup.py to create the appropriate antlr3 symlink based on
python version
- Changed the error reporting interface of antlr3-python3 runtime to
be compatible with what existing Congress code expects
(thirdparty/antlr3-antlr-3.5/runtime/Python3/antlr3/recognizers.py)

Result: tox -e py34 no longer reports any errors traced to antlr code.

Notes:
- Supporting both Python versions was not straightforward because
neither the antlr runtime nor the antlr generated code is
cross-version compatible.
- Making symlinks via setup.py is not ideal, but the best solution
I came up with among several I considered. If you have better ideas
please suggest.
- Making our own custom changes to antlr3-python3 runtime is not
ideal, but it was necessary because for some reason the
antlr3-python3 runtime broke error reporting interface compatibility
with antlr3-python2 runtime, leading to test failures in
test_compile.py and test_congress.py.
In theory, supporting our custom changes in antlr3 runtime bad, but
because antlr3 is not supported anyway, the situation is really no
worse than before. In addition, the changes are fairly minor.
- antlr4 was not adopted because it does not have support for
abstract syntax trees.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3

Change-Id: I376aee803c4dc9953c1b5ba9311cf9c4a42f3319

subject: Windows Scheduler
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-17 16:43:43.000000000', 'files': ['freezer/scheduler/arguments.py', 'freezer/scheduler/freezer_scheduler.py', 'freezer/winutils.py', 'setup.py', 'freezer/scheduler/win_daemon.py', 'setup.cfg', 'freezer/scheduler/win_service.py'], 'message': 'Windows Scheduler

freezer runs the scheduler as a windows service
the service is divided in two parts:
    win_daemon, which interacts with freezer-api and freezer-agent
    win_service, which install freezer scheduler

Change-Id: I148105a7efd3cead6817cbc2dab255451fb3b9a4
'}]
commit_message:
Windows Scheduler

freezer runs the scheduler as a windows service
the service is divided in two parts:
    win_daemon, which interacts with freezer-api and freezer-agent
    win_service, which install freezer scheduler

Change-Id: I148105a7efd3cead6817cbc2dab255451fb3b9a4

commit_message:
Fail when Neutron calls limits APIs.

According to http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/project_scope.html?highlight=proxy#no-more-api-proxies,
Nova APIs shouldn't be used a proxies for in other openstack services.  This fix
raises an HTTPBadRequest (400) exception if Neutron calls the UsedLimits or Limits APIs.

Change-Id: I821aa0a3975f2be879851e9cb556cd6de24e7170
Closes-Bug: #1186354

commit_message:
Note that BandwidthUsage relates to Instance

It's not obvious (at least I completely missed it) that the uuid field
on BandwidthUsage is a reference to an instance uuid. Renaming the field
instance_uuid would be nice but a lot of work for little benefit, so
let's just put a comment.

Change-Id: I5d5b009f6da9e6c3e176be7cb62c363235978b63

commit_message:
neutron-db-manage: mark several options as deprecated

I believe we don't rely on --core_plugin or --quota_driver for the tool
because database contents are independent of chosen plugins and drivers
since ~Juno.

Also marked --service with deprecated_for_removal=True.

Related-Bug: #1501380
Change-Id: I2b4d98242a0d38843d931a71414ef2560a7ddb8f

subject: Update mistral::db::sync to run 'update head'
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-21 23:55:33.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/db/sync.pp', 'manifests/db/postgresql.pp', 'spec/classes/mistral_db_sync_spec.rb', 'manifests/params.pp'], 'message': 'Update mistral::db::sync to run 'update head'

This patch modifies mistral::db::sync so that it
runs 'update head' instead of 'populate'. We
will likely want to create a new module called
mistral::db::populate that runs just the populate
command.

This brings the mistral "db_sync" class more inline
with other Puppet Openstack modules that run DB sync
and fixes issues in bootstrapping mistral in that
running populate without first having an 'upgrade head'
would always fail.

Change-Id: I9aa02fa8ba2c42aa830c8b0eb556e769b45013f4
'}]
commit_message:
Update mistral::db::sync to run 'update head'

This patch modifies mistral::db::sync so that it
runs 'update head' instead of 'populate'. We
will likely want to create a new module called
mistral::db::populate that runs just the populate
command.

This brings the mistral "db_sync" class more inline
with other Puppet Openstack modules that run DB sync
and fixes issues in bootstrapping mistral in that
running populate without first having an 'upgrade head'
would always fail.

Change-Id: I9aa02fa8ba2c42aa830c8b0eb556e769b45013f4

commit_message:
Integration of Ceilometer in Watcher

In current implementation is not easy to use ceilometer.
Watcher must query metrics from the Telemetry v2 API to allow an easiest integration with OpenStack components (especially devstack).

blueprint telemetry-integration
Change-Id: Ide515472f1d160925d9f4aabf48c96dea4f6bc05

subject: Make VPN functional jobs voting
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-21 15:11:11.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Make VPN functional jobs voting

Now that the VPN functional jobs running with the new job template have been
running non-voting, we can re-add the jobs to the gate queue and make them
voting.

Verified that the jobs, using the new template, ran with a Neutron commit,
using experimental job (see review 242222/6).

Later, based on community decision, the VPN functional job for StrongSwan
can be moved from Neutron experimental queue, to a voting queue.

Change-Id: I809ef7e61eaddcbfd11c26b218c784622f588c1d
Partial-Bug: 1495584
'}]
commit_message:
Make VPN functional jobs voting

Now that the VPN functional jobs running with the new job template have been
running non-voting, we can re-add the jobs to the gate queue and make them
voting.

Verified that the jobs, using the new template, ran with a Neutron commit,
using experimental job (see review 242222/6).

Later, based on community decision, the VPN functional job for StrongSwan
can be moved from Neutron experimental queue, to a voting queue.

Change-Id: I809ef7e61eaddcbfd11c26b218c784622f588c1d
Partial-Bug: 1495584

commit_message:
Split abandon into pre-abandon(export) and abandon

Splits the existing abandon action into two actions as
below:
1. export: User is recommended to run export successfully
   before doing the abandon action. It returns the stack
   data, which can be used for adopting stack.
2. abandon: Abandons the given stack

Partial-Bug: #1353670

Co-Authored-By: Jason Dunsmore <jasondunsmore@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I65264d91b1378df9cb3e492bc6ccaa778940dd6b

subject: Ignore KeyError for secret field
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 03:02:06.000000000', 'files': ['congress/managers/datasource.py'], 'message': "Ignore KeyError for secret field

Although it doesn't make sense to create a datasource without
providing auth info in config info, it may be not possible to
define a schema to verify because different datasource drivers
may use different kinds of auth methods. So we should be able
to handle the case that none secret info is provided. The fix
just simply ignores KeyError exception here.

Change-Id: I06bc6a4fb659d862da96dd96557454b6385d003f
Closes-Bug: #1492354
(cherry picked from commit 22210a9ee65526ca0ccaf448260d2d9de0ff9c12)
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore KeyError for secret field

Although it doesn't make sense to create a datasource without
providing auth info in config info, it may be not possible to
define a schema to verify because different datasource drivers
may use different kinds of auth methods. So we should be able
to handle the case that none secret info is provided. The fix
just simply ignores KeyError exception here.

Change-Id: I06bc6a4fb659d862da96dd96557454b6385d003f
Closes-Bug: #1492354
(cherry picked from commit 22210a9ee65526ca0ccaf448260d2d9de0ff9c12)

When a tenant access a subresource, neutron will check that this
tenant is allowed to view this subresource, according to the policy.json.
The plugin must return the tenant_id parameter when a "show/list/delete"
action is performed, so that the policy framework can check authz.

This patch also set the network_id as a mandatory parameter

Fixes-Bug: #1512789

commit_message:
Add tenant-id to subresources

When a tenant access a subresource, neutron will check that this
tenant is allowed to view this subresource, according to the policy.json.
The plugin must return the tenant_id parameter when a "show/list/delete"
action is performed, so that the policy framework can check authz.

This patch also set the network_id as a mandatory parameter
in the network_association table.

Change-Id: I59d2dbb5416b566dc7de3acb4fab3ed2ada8b78e
Fixes-Bug: #1512789

commit_message:
Remove qpidd's driver from the tree

Back in liberty we marked this driver as deprecated. This patch removes
it from the tree. The patch also removes tests, options and other
references in the documentation. Note that one script is being kept
because it's required by the amqp driver.

Depends-On: If4b1773334e424d1f4a4e112bd1f10aca62682a9
Change-Id: I4a9cba314c4a2f24307504fa7b5427424268b114

commit_message:
Check prefix with startswith() instead of slicing

Replaced string slicing with startswith() method to check for prefixes.
The startswith() is cleaner and less error prone thus enhances the readibility and stability of the code.

Change-Id: Ia2e9a02128ef11cdf7512c96726503b85edc52aa

commit_message:
Adds test case for the iscsi_ilo recreate boot iso

When using web server for hosting images for ilo driver,
take_over should recreate the boot ISO, if it was created
by Ironic. This fix is done as part of the feature patch
I5481e705892f66cb3184ac16ff56c123f5c69087 in boot.py from
lines 117-122.
The test case for this bug is missing in the feature patch
and hence adding it here in this patch.

Related-Bug: #1510425

Change-Id: I6b7f3901f773a5aba906c50dcbd574412f7b6af3

commit_message:
Import pep3134daemon as local module

pep3134daemon is now imported from local path
rather than pip. This generated many issues
as the package is not in the global-requirements.txt
of kilo and liberty. Also pbr in the kilo release
does not support env markers which further complitated
the installation. This change needs to be backported to
stable/kilo also.

Also some minor fix for RST format.

Compared to the liberty commit this one is cherry-picked from, a few
modifications were needed:

requirements.txt : Tiny reorganisation
setup.py : Removal of the old platform-dependant deps installation

Change-Id: I34db28ffc928703b01e6430a661214d66d81c519
(cherry picked from commit 3abf2080f1ed0ec733e246af9ff877ac84159c52)

subject: Don't force Fn::Select index to integer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-20 15:19:06.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_template.py', 'heat/engine/cfn/functions.py'], 'message': "Don't force Fn::Select index to integer

Fn::Select try to cast its index argument to integer in all the cases,
but it also needs to use it as a string when you give it a mapping. This
moves the cast after the mapping case has been handled.

Change-Id: I84ff404d3a26fb51c2048e43851b1ef5e3031d67
Closes-Bug: #1518337
"}]
commit_message:
Don't force Fn::Select index to integer

Fn::Select try to cast its index argument to integer in all the cases,
but it also needs to use it as a string when you give it a mapping. This
moves the cast after the mapping case has been handled.

Change-Id: I84ff404d3a26fb51c2048e43851b1ef5e3031d67
Closes-Bug: #1518337

commit_message:
Port EMC VMAX to Python 3

* Fix EMCVMAXMasking._get_storage_group_from_masking_view_instance():
  replace "if groups[0] > 0:" with "if len(groups):"
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_emc_vmax

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I0f6be3cc0873efe683d39c4c70e19d0d0b79beb8

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-13 09:26:41.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_vnxdirect.py', 'tests-py3.txt', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vnx_cli.py'], 'message': 'Port EMC VNX CLI to Python 3

CreateConsistencyGroupTask, WaitMigrationsCompleteTask: sort the lun
identifier keys to have a determinist order. On Python 3, the hash
function is randomized, so set() order is undefined and changes at
each run.

Other changes:

* Replace map() with list-comprehension to get a list on Python 3.
* Replace assertTrue(str.find(pattern) > 0) with
  assertIn(pattern, str) to not fail if pattern is at the beginning
  on the string. On Python 3, the hash function is randomized and so
  parts of the provider_location are in a random order, it can be at
  the beginning.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_emc_vnxdirect

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I114029c1c9862583e64781379001870a682ea42d
'}]
commit_message:
Port EMC VNX CLI to Python 3

CreateConsistencyGroupTask, WaitMigrationsCompleteTask: sort the lun
identifier keys to have a determinist order. On Python 3, the hash
function is randomized, so set() order is undefined and changes at
each run.

Other changes:

* Replace map() with list-comprehension to get a list on Python 3.
* Replace assertTrue(str.find(pattern) > 0) with
  assertIn(pattern, str) to not fail if pattern is at the beginning
  on the string. On Python 3, the hash function is randomized and so
  parts of the provider_location are in a random order, it can be at
  the beginning.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_emc_vnxdirect

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I114029c1c9862583e64781379001870a682ea42d

The input of set_power_state() is different from the real string
it sends to Ironic service in json data. The power states were
translated in set_power_state(). Using a dict to map the translation
is more clear, and easier to add new power states.

Change-Id: I8c7dac1ac39f92b2031e7f1fa95cd5c398a708d5

Related-to: blueprint soft-reboot-poweroff

commit_message:
Use a dict to translate node power states to json data.

The input of set_power_state() is different from the real string
it sends to Ironic service in json data. The power states were
translated in set_power_state(). Using a dict to map the translation
is more clear, and easier to add new power states.

Change-Id: I8c7dac1ac39f92b2031e7f1fa95cd5c398a708d5
Implements: blueprint enhance-power-interface-for-soft-reboot-and-nmi
Related-to: blueprint soft-reboot-poweroff
Related-to: blueprint instance-crash-dump

commit_message:
Disallow user modifing ACTIVE_IMMUTABLE of deactivated images

Currently the user can change the ACTIVE_IMMUTABLE properties whilst
the image is 'deactivated'. This should not be the case once an image
has become 'active'.

APIImpact
Change-Id: I744fbce90893008ef49568c3cba47bf0e26dec9d
Closes-Bug: 1517060
Closes-Bug: 1517963

commit_message:
Add Reject option to Firewall Rules

Although Neutron API and Neutronclient support Reject action
in Firewall Rule, it is missing in Horizon. This change
proposes to add the 'Reject' action option to the Firewall
rule in the 'Add Rule' workflow and the 'Edit Rule' form.

Change-Id: Ibf6072948becdc1852464826a04f08127bd85113
Closes-Bug: #1516856

commit_message:
Add "httpchk /versions" for glance-api haproxy.

With the default httpchk, glance-api always show warning in the logs
"WARNING glance.api.middleware.version_negotiation [..] Unknown version.
Returning version choices", with the /versions added, there is no
warning in the log.

Change-Id: I086cb23c30b9e3ddc5eac68cba42d03ed907138c

commit_message:
[Verify] Fixing issue with SSL deployments

Now options 'disable_ssl_certificate_validation' and 'ca_certificates_file'
are configured in the Tempest config file and values for these options are
taken from credentials that user specified.

Config options https_insecure and https_cacert were removed since they were
marked as "deprecated_for_removal".

Change-Id: I74083bc9af21969dd836f852712b81abd3ec74dc

commit_message:
[Ci] Check Heat service availability in tests.ci.osresources

Make a check if `heat' service is available
in tests.ci.osresources to prevent failures while quering heat
resources on jobs that does not have heat installed.

This fixes issues with job gate-rally-dsvm-manila-multibackend

Change-Id: Id3c4c24114d6db99e9e4fce43162fa6ce0b20d61
Closes-Bug: #1518913

subject: Get mandatory patch attrs from WSME properties
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}, {'_account_id': 13362, 'name': 'Tan Lin', 'email': 'lin.tan@intel.com', 'username': 'zero'}, {'_account_id': 15482, 'name': 'xu chao', 'email': 'xu.chao@99cloud.net', 'username': 'xuchao'}, {'_account_id': 18893, 'name': 'Miles Gould', 'email': 'mgould@redhat.com', 'username': 'pozorvlak'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-11-17 14:41:15.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/types.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/port.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/chassis.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_ports.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_types.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'message': 'Get mandatory patch attrs from WSME properties

Attributes which are mandatory (ie, required for object creation) should
not be removable. However, some attributes (such as Node.chassis_uuid)
are not required for object creation, but should not be removable if
they are set. This commit does the following:

 - rename JsonPatchType.mandatory_attrs to non_removable_attrs to better
   describe its meaning,
 - change its return type to set-of-strings for faster lookup
 - ensure all mandatory attributes on the type being patched are
   included in the set of non-removable attributes,
 - add a new field, JsonPatchType._extra_non_removable_attrs, which
   should be a set of attributes that are not required for creation but
   should not be removed if set.

Since the object to be patched does not exist at patch-validation time,
we leave the validation logic in methods of JsonPatchType and
subclasses. This means introspecting the types to be patched.

Closes-Bug: #1284781

Change-Id: I2bb7fed2c776c8d63535c5ee19cdc218e57806e3
'}]
commit_message:
Get mandatory patch attrs from WSME properties

Attributes which are mandatory (ie, required for object creation) should
not be removable. However, some attributes (such as Node.chassis_uuid)
are not required for object creation, but should not be removable if
they are set. This commit does the following:

 - rename JsonPatchType.mandatory_attrs to non_removable_attrs to better
   describe its meaning,
 - change its return type to set-of-strings for faster lookup
 - ensure all mandatory attributes on the type being patched are
   included in the set of non-removable attributes,
 - add a new field, JsonPatchType._extra_non_removable_attrs, which
   should be a set of attributes that are not required for creation but
   should not be removed if set.

Since the object to be patched does not exist at patch-validation time,
we leave the validation logic in methods of JsonPatchType and
subclasses. This means introspecting the types to be patched.

Closes-Bug: #1284781

Change-Id: I2bb7fed2c776c8d63535c5ee19cdc218e57806e3

commit_message:
Fix mistypes and minor code style issues
1. Fix mistypes, except interfaces
2. Fix old style classes (now inherit from object)
3. Fix single quoted docstrings
4. Redundant parenthesis
5. shadow builtins in locals (aka str or type as variable names)

Change-Id: Ie7c746c6e603472452766ba96cd94a6a3b232d6c
Closes-bug: #1517507

commit_message:
VMware: enable two more values in validators for gw devices

This patch simply ensures the network gateway API extension accepts
value with an underscore for ipsec transport types.
Unfortunately this module was not moved to openstack/vmware-nsx
during decomposition and therefore this patch is being proposed on
the neutron repository.

Change-Id: I5e8532ea73dac286bab1c7e39a7e0b33681e2d7e
Partial-Bug: #1474834

commit_message:
Add constraints and timeouts from file in single step

To avoid pcmk reconfiguring the resources on each config change,
we want to apply the constraints and timeouts from file.

We also *do not* want to alter the timeouts for a few ocf resources
which are rabbitmq, neutron-netns-cleanup and neutron-ovs-cleanup

Change-Id: I6875f19e1f34f0fdcf0928421f49b61d857ca7c8
Co-Authored-By: Andrew Beekhof <abeekhof@redhat.com>

subject: Fix argument order for assertEqual to (expected, observed)
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 17776, 'name': 'Reedip', 'email': 'reedip.banerjee@gmail.com', 'username': 'Reedip'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-19 10:07:22.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/tests/unit/test_midonet_plugin.py', 'midonet/neutron/tests/unit/test_midonet_plugin_v2.py', 'midonet/neutron/tests/unit/test_extension_lbaas.py', 'midonet/neutron/tests/unit/test_extension_agent_membership.py'], 'message': 'Fix argument order for assertEqual to (expected, observed)

assertEqual expects that the arguments provided to it should be
(expected, observed).If a particluar order is kept as a convention,
then it helps to provide a cleaner message to the developer if Unit Tests
fail. There are several Unit Test files where the arguments for assertEqual
have been swapped. This commit fixes the issue in networking-midonet.

Change-Id: I00daee7e5628151e38d8becdfa7057c78aa48abe
Closes-Bug: #1259292
(cherry picked from commit c3bcfd3dd5b3482df9a018d7a668d9f8232b0175)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix argument order for assertEqual to (expected, observed)

assertEqual expects that the arguments provided to it should be
(expected, observed).If a particluar order is kept as a convention,
then it helps to provide a cleaner message to the developer if Unit Tests
fail. There are several Unit Test files where the arguments for assertEqual
have been swapped. This commit fixes the issue in networking-midonet.

Change-Id: I00daee7e5628151e38d8becdfa7057c78aa48abe
Closes-Bug: #1259292
(cherry picked from commit c3bcfd3dd5b3482df9a018d7a668d9f8232b0175)

commit_message:
Import pep3134daemon as local module

pep3134daemon is now imported from local path
rather than pip. This generated many issues
as the package is not in the global-requirements.txt
of kilo and liberty. Also pbr in the kilo release
does not support env markers which further complitated
the installation. This change needs to be backported to
stable/kilo also.

Also some minor fix for RST format.

Change-Id: I34db28ffc928703b01e6430a661214d66d81c519

commit_message:
Added logging for haproxy to rsyslog

The change adds logging for haproxy on localhost through the use
of rsyslog which is now a dependency. The logs will be stored in
/var/log/haproxy which will later be indexed and shipped to the
logging server. The change makes it possible to debug issues with
haproxy using specific log files instead of having to go digging
through syslog.

Change-Id: Id942ce159ea45703259f7aff0e5a85780a83370b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 08a0f535503c9d709b2d9375a7f17f9841d01d0d)

subject: Kilo backport
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 12:17:55.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/extensions/test_bgpvpn.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/plugin.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/extensions/bgpvpn.py'], 'message': 'Kilo backport

Service_provider in neutron.conf
	In kilo it is not possible to add service
	provider config. Thats why the configuration has
	to be set in neutron.conf

Add namespace to extension
	In kilo an extension for neutron still
	needs a get_namespace method.

Hack around neutrons fixed plugin rules
	The list of allowed services is fixed in kilo.
	This commit adds BGPVPN to the allowed services.

Align unittests to kilo
	bgpvpn_id is given in kwargs not in args.

Change-Id: I3b5fa02af73c6111d38a7e99f372e25e2e469510
'}]
commit_message:
Kilo backport

Service_provider in neutron.conf
	In kilo it is not possible to add service
	provider config. Thats why the configuration has
	to be set in neutron.conf

Add namespace to extension
	In kilo an extension for neutron still
	needs a get_namespace method.

Hack around neutrons fixed plugin rules
	The list of allowed services is fixed in kilo.
	This commit adds BGPVPN to the allowed services.

Align unittests to kilo
	bgpvpn_id is given in kwargs not in args.

Change-Id: I3b5fa02af73c6111d38a7e99f372e25e2e469510

subject: Reset stack status even when lock engine_id is None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-17 23:08:47.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_delete.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/engine/stack_lock.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Reset stack status even when lock engine_id is None

Having a stack which is wedged UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS due to another bug,
restarting heat-engine should have resulted in the stack being reset to
UPDATE_FAILED. However the reset was skipped because the lock engine_id
was None.

This change removes the engine_id check since it is possible in practice
for an UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS stack to not be locked.

Since it is possible for the stack to change state in the unlocked
window, a check is added that the stack is still IN_PROGRESS before the
reset is performed.

Change-Id: I1739ccbdf75af35aac5be16b99200975df58b8e2
Closes-Bug: #1514615
(cherry picked from commit 44b2f0965dd329cf45a151705b0648819acff8c7)
'}]
commit_message:
Reset stack status even when lock engine_id is None

Having a stack which is wedged UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS due to another bug,
restarting heat-engine should have resulted in the stack being reset to
UPDATE_FAILED. However the reset was skipped because the lock engine_id
was None.

This change removes the engine_id check since it is possible in practice
for an UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS stack to not be locked.

Since it is possible for the stack to change state in the unlocked
window, a check is added that the stack is still IN_PROGRESS before the
reset is performed.

Change-Id: I1739ccbdf75af35aac5be16b99200975df58b8e2
Closes-Bug: #1514615
(cherry picked from commit 44b2f0965dd329cf45a151705b0648819acff8c7)

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-11-10 09:24:58.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/expose-quiesce-unquiesce-api.rst'], 'message': "Expose quiesce unquiesce API

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which will
take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will quiesce
unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Atomic quiesce / unquiesce API will allow to make snapshot of a group of VMs
in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,
the order is important for a group of VMs with strong relationship.

APIImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API
DocImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API

Blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/expose-quiesce-unquiesce-api

Change-Id: I3cc247fba7a07dceb42704022444a450c31ea0e8
Signed-off-by: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Expose quiesce unquiesce API

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which will
take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will quiesce
unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Atomic quiesce / unquiesce API will allow to make snapshot of a group of VMs
in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,
the order is important for a group of VMs with strong relationship.

APIImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API
DocImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API

Blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/expose-quiesce-unquiesce-api

Change-Id: I3cc247fba7a07dceb42704022444a450c31ea0e8
Signed-off-by: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>

There are various discussions about the fact that Juno is EOL in

commit_message:
Document an EOL and release dates

There are various discussions about the fact that Juno is EOL in
November, but there is no hard documented date when such a thing is
expected to happen. Document when Juno was released and when it will EOL
- as well as the same for kilo, liberty and mitaka.

Change-Id: Iada72d966e93b8ff1f0febb4473a92fdd0532e51

Change-Id: I4dc5dd35e4aeee498dd8960a1000913e97b924d5

commit_message:
Copy the env to the backup stack in failed update

When an update fails, we currently update the environment of the stack
to contain both the new and old parameters and types. Unfortunately we
don't do that for the backup stack which is reused. This patch adds the
environment change.

Change-Id: I4dc5dd35e4aeee498dd8960a1000913e97b924d5
Closes-Bug: 1508096
(cherry picked from commit 88da460316e2c18b3ceb58f51dcf0bda717a18a3
                       and 13c68910704844719b2d3de353d2db276377bf11)

commit_message:

This patch extends the existing _retry_on_deadlock function to also
retry certain database transactions when a connection error occurs

commit_message:
Retry certain DB transactions on DBConnectionError

This patch extends the existing _retry_on_deadlock function to also
retry certain database transactions when a connection error occurs
(oslo.db.exception.DBConnectionError). This has the benefit of providing
some tolerance for database restarts.

Change-Id: Ia2a658a2e7bc050553539122bbc01d5784d8dc92

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-10-23 08:20:25.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/db/base.py', 'glance/db/simple/api.py', 'glance/api/v2/images.py', 'glance/db/__init__.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Fixes a race during v2 concurrent image update

Introduces an optimistic lock when updating images in database:
if another request has modified the previously fetched image
the update query will fail (as it is filtered by exact match of last timestamp),
which wil raise a Conflict exception

Change-Id: I1387137a980aa7d7b81a64376c46ba430830630a
Closes-Bug: #1371728
Partial-Bug: #1372564
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes a race during v2 concurrent image update

Introduces an optimistic lock when updating images in database:
if another request has modified the previously fetched image
the update query will fail (as it is filtered by exact match of last timestamp),
which wil raise a Conflict exception

Change-Id: I1387137a980aa7d7b81a64376c46ba430830630a
Closes-Bug: #1371728
Partial-Bug: #1372564

subject: Drop eventlet getsockopt workaround
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-06 09:55:12.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/common/https.py', 'glanceclient/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Drop eventlet getsockopt workaround

Workaround for eventlet getsockopt has been added in
I187b69f75b8bcfe16facd41e69b1cd0490dae605 with explicit statement that
it should be dropped after eventlet fix it on their side. The fix has
been already merged
https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/commits/609f230 so we are free
to drop our workaround for this one.

Change-Id: I3da4a0430e7e9ce1191ef0f3f67adb295d450a24
'}]
commit_message:
Drop eventlet getsockopt workaround

Workaround for eventlet getsockopt has been added in
I187b69f75b8bcfe16facd41e69b1cd0490dae605 with explicit statement that
it should be dropped after eventlet fix it on their side. The fix has
been already merged
https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/commits/609f230 so we are free
to drop our workaround for this one.

Change-Id: I3da4a0430e7e9ce1191ef0f3f67adb295d450a24

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-23 10:22:49.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v2/images.py'], 'message': "Check updated properties are actually updated in V2

When an image is being updated, V2 doesn't check if a parameter
is actually being updated. It would be good to catch this
before the client sends it to the server.

Change-Id: Ibf348d2e04494fa3e7802758add1fd740d62f2a1

commit_message:
Check updated properties are actually updated in V2

When an image is being updated, V2 doesn't check if a parameter
is actually being updated. It would be good to catch this
before the client sends it to the server.

Change-Id: Ibf348d2e04494fa3e7802758add1fd740d62f2a1
Fixes-bug: #1307412

commit_message:
Replace tearDown with addCleanup in unit tests

Infra team has indicated that tearDown should not be used, and should
be replaced with addCleanup in all places. This patch removes the
few cases of tearDown in Glance.

Change-Id: I8f8ff3ed653a44893b50ccb2f89bdb3a3809216a

commit_message:
Make path for db_export_metadefs required

Currently if you call glance-manage db_export_metadefs without
any additional options, it will export all current metadefs
into the glance conf dir (e.g. /etc/glance/metadefs/) without
any warning. If the files already exist it will overwrite them.
Fix make glance-manage db_export_metadefs to require path
for destination folder to hold metadefs.
glance-manage db_export_metadefs /tmp

Change-Id: I561be5a205c2909b7bf80e2e3d10fa3c39f98cba
Closes-Bug: 1367011
DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate [paste_deploy]/flavor for auth_strategy

All other projects have switched from using flavor to auth_strategy,
this will bring glance's config files into compliance with other
openstack projects making it easier for deployers to understand what
they're configuring.

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact
Closes-bug: 1406582
Change-Id: I48da664c0f068310b7994e4c3b65046b99395d5c

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-09 14:44:36.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v1/images.py', 'glanceclient/v2/images.py'], 'message': 'Integrity check for images with checksum = "None"

Images on "External sources" have checksum = "None" in the glance db.
These images could be uploaded for example with:
glance image-create --name test-image
               --location=http://some.location.com/image.raw ...

Trying to start an instance with "boot from image (creates volume)"
fails with "Checksum was xxxxxx expected None"

This change will fix this error.

Closes-Bug: 1434040
Change-Id: I9871ee42b1b4572b7e5de9fc912d96ae6996b875
'}]
commit_message:
Integrity check for images with checksum = "None"

Images on "External sources" have checksum = "None" in the glance db.
These images could be uploaded for example with:
glance image-create --name test-image
               --location=http://some.location.com/image.raw ...

Trying to start an instance with "boot from image (creates volume)"
fails with "Checksum was xxxxxx expected None"

This change will fix this error.

Closes-Bug: 1434040
Change-Id: I9871ee42b1b4572b7e5de9fc912d96ae6996b875

commit_message:
force option now acts as boolean, just like can-share

There was some inconsistency in glanceclient options, some boolean
flags were used as boolean while some others required {True,False}.
Now these options can be used like boolean flags, for example
--is-public and --is-public {True,False} both are allowed. We, after
comming to a common solution, can depricate one method if required(i
prefer to depricate {True,False} method).

Closes-Bug: #1221769
Change-Id: I146e06bf0554ff9184859f3e283629cb5e5c51db

commit_message:
glance v2 image-list now has human-readable option

size of glance images is stored in bytes, but when images are
listed size is displayed in bytes, and it is in not easy for users to
convert size in human understandable format, so added human-readable
option to glance image-list

Change-Id: I85424780b2afe346b218b87949093c157e485371
Closes-Bug: #1433430

commit_message:
Fix HTTP 500 on NotAuthenticated in registry (v1)

If for some reason (absent\invalid token) authentication failed during a
registry call, InternalServerError appeared as long as
exception.NotAuthenticated was not being caught in ImagesController.

This patch fixes the issue by catching the exception and raising
401 Unauthorized.

Change-Id: I38554d166d0d5d16849dbcf7d94158a65d20717d
Closes-Bug: #1450041

commit_message:
Use oslo.versionedobjects to define artifact types

This patch adds a set of classes which inherit
oslo_versionedobjects.fields.Field type and provide plugin developer
with an ability to define the structure of artifacts using
oslo.versionedobjects as an laternative to the existing "declarative
framework" defined at glance.common.artifacts.definitions.

This is the first patch of the series: for complete support of
oslo.versionedobjects appropriate changes have to be introduced in
plugin loader, object serializer, domain layers etc.

Work-in-progress, but reviews are most appreciated.

Depends-on: I17328209b0b5334c24c893828e04ef19c7354148

Change-Id: I82b500ac6a5fde6a60054a804146dc6ee9dc2a8f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-31 11:44:34.000000000', 'files': ['etc/glance-registry-paste.ini', 'glance/tests/unit/common/test_config.py', 'glance/tests/functional/__init__.py', 'glance/api/middleware/context.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_context_middleware.py', 'etc/glance-api-paste.ini'], 'message': "Request-id is not getting returned if glance throws 500 error.

Added 'request_id' and 'catch_errors' middleware from oslo_middleware
to return request-id from response. 'catch_errors' is added to catch
all exceptions from application and 'request_id' is used to add
request-id for each API response.

Only 'catch_errors' middleware is added for glance-registry because
here we need to use same request-id generated in glance-api.
If we add 'request_id' middleware to glance-registry then it will
generate new request-id.

Removed BaseContextMiddleware class because now request_id
middleware will add 'request-id' to response headers.

Also this patch fixes below issue:
1. Request ID has a double 'req-' at the start
2. User can send invalid (long string) as request-id to glance
   service using 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header field.

DocImpact:
1. Added new WSGI middlewares 'request_id' and 'catch_errors' to
   glance-api-paste.ini file.
2. Added new WSGI middleware 'catch_errors' to
   glance-registry-paste.ini file.
3. Do not add 'request_id' middleware to glance-registry-paste.ini,
   otherwise it will generate new request-id for glance-registry
   and will not use request-id passed from glance-api.

Closes-Bug: #1480196
Closes-Bug: #1480191
Closes-Bug: #1478690

Change-Id: Iedd17a9981a4089b4d875dad87c6d5a07a368c24
"}]
commit_message:
Request-id is not getting returned if glance throws 500 error.

Added 'request_id' and 'catch_errors' middleware from oslo_middleware
to return request-id from response. 'catch_errors' is added to catch
all exceptions from application and 'request_id' is used to add
request-id for each API response.

Only 'catch_errors' middleware is added for glance-registry because
here we need to use same request-id generated in glance-api.
If we add 'request_id' middleware to glance-registry then it will
generate new request-id.

Removed BaseContextMiddleware class because now request_id
middleware will add 'request-id' to response headers.

Also this patch fixes below issue:
1. Request ID has a double 'req-' at the start
2. User can send invalid (long string) as request-id to glance
   service using 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header field.

DocImpact:
1. Added new WSGI middlewares 'request_id' and 'catch_errors' to
   glance-api-paste.ini file.
2. Added new WSGI middleware 'catch_errors' to
   glance-registry-paste.ini file.
3. Do not add 'request_id' middleware to glance-registry-paste.ini,
   otherwise it will generate new request-id for glance-registry
   and will not use request-id passed from glance-api.

Closes-Bug: #1480196
Closes-Bug: #1480191
Closes-Bug: #1478690

Change-Id: Iedd17a9981a4089b4d875dad87c6d5a07a368c24

commit_message:
Parallelizes deleting image segments

When an image is deleted, all its segments are deleted in a serial
fashion. This may lead to slower image deletes especially for images
with a lot of segments. This is a natural target for parallelization
to gain performance on image delete requests.

Change-Id: Ifb7bc54ee10b0999b5a4c7d4f97a618e36342b29

commit_message:
Add option to wait between swift retries

This adds two new options:

    swift_store_retry_get_wait = 1
    swift_store_retry_get_exponential_wait = True

These complement the existing option, swift_store_retry_get_count. If
swift_store_retry_get_wait is not 0, glance will delay by the number of
milliseconds that option specifies between each retry.

If swift_store_retry_get_exponential_wait is set to True, those wait
times are doubled at each successive retry.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint swift-retry-wait

Change-Id: I575eb501153615e262aaa13202797d25458717c7

subject: Delegate string formatting to logger
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-28 20:59:04.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/gridfs.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/s3.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/vmware_datastore.py', 'glance_store/common/auth.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/cinder.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py', 'glance_store/driver.py', 'glance_store/common/utils.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/filesystem.py', 'glance_store/backend.py'], 'message': "Delegate string formatting to logger

This patch refactors some of the logging to delay performing string
formatting, which means that the formatting can be skipped if the log
level is set such that the message will not be emitted. This is already
done in some places, but this patch standardizes the where the
formatting is done.

The change is mostly along the lines of changing:

    LOG.debug('something is %s' % something)

into:

    LOG.debug('something is %s', something)

Change-Id: Iff7b76baa78675562dfbe8f2905806557cee245e
"}]
commit_message:
Delegate string formatting to logger

This patch refactors some of the logging to delay performing string
formatting, which means that the formatting can be skipped if the log
level is set such that the message will not be emitted. This is already
done in some places, but this patch standardizes the where the
formatting is done.

The change is mostly along the lines of changing:

    LOG.debug('something is %s' % something)

into:

    LOG.debug('something is %s', something)

Change-Id: Iff7b76baa78675562dfbe8f2905806557cee245e

"pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound" exception when
python-glanceclient is used by an application packaged

commit_message:
Add the trigger field to the tasks table

This change adds the trigger field to the Tasks table as stated in the
spec. This field will be used to identify tasks that were triggered
automatically by a TaskTrigger.

This patch is the last one involving database changes related to this
bp.

Partially-Implements blueprint: task-engine-enhancement

Change-Id: Ia72fdec5720c86e4098c1d772f4c082944e685ff

commit_message:
Default number of swift download retries to 5

This is a useful option to have enabled by default, giving resilience to
network outages during image downloads from swift. Other stores with retry
options (VMWare and cinder stores) also have them enabled by default.

DocImpact

Related-to: blueprint swift-retry-wait

Change-Id: Ia09b4ed5bd1fff73145df87fd1bced849a96b3da

subject: Metadef namespace field namespace is not unique in MySQL
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-10 12:28:28.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/sqlalchemy/models_metadef.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v2/test_metadef_namespaces.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/042_add_unique_namespace_index.py'], 'message': "Metadef namespace field namespace is not unique in MySQL

The metadef namespace model has a field called namespace which should be
unique across the database. It's used by the API to show details of the
namespace instead of the id (which is not exposed anywhere). In our
current implementation user is able to create two same namespaces, and
after that if he wish to list all the namespaces the 500 response will
be returned. Same response is returned when trying to get details of
this newly created namespace.

To reproduce this issue locally you need to:
1. Set the GLANCE_TEST_SQL_CONNECTION environment variable to point to
MySQL database connection, eg.
GLANCE_TEST_SQL_CONNECTION='mysql://root:pass@127.0.0.1/glance_test?charset=utf8'
2. Run specific test provided in this patch
tox -e py27 glance.tests.functional.v2.test_metadef_namespaces

Change-Id: I945e0c84b5e6a66c945c60ba0c8126d9111c0812
Closes-Bug: 1463036
"}]
commit_message:
Metadef namespace field namespace is not unique in MySQL

The metadef namespace model has a field called namespace which should be
unique across the database. It's used by the API to show details of the
namespace instead of the id (which is not exposed anywhere). In our
current implementation user is able to create two same namespaces, and
after that if he wish to list all the namespaces the 500 response will
be returned. Same response is returned when trying to get details of
this newly created namespace.

To reproduce this issue locally you need to:
1. Set the GLANCE_TEST_SQL_CONNECTION environment variable to point to
MySQL database connection, eg.
GLANCE_TEST_SQL_CONNECTION='mysql://root:pass@127.0.0.1/glance_test?charset=utf8'
2. Run specific test provided in this patch
tox -e py27 glance.tests.functional.v2.test_metadef_namespaces

Change-Id: I945e0c84b5e6a66c945c60ba0c8126d9111c0812
Closes-Bug: 1463036

commit_message:
Removed schema caching

Removed the schema caching function and unit tests
since the cache was not being used anywhere.
The schema caching function was used to determine
the glance api version.
It is replaced by the "__get_glance_api_version" function.

Closes-Bug: #1490635

Change-Id: Id4b7638357f379f17c48394990a378a6cdf0e240

The Glanceclient currently raises HTTP errors, this is confusing as

Closes-bug: 1493859

commit_message:
Remove raising HTTP Errors

The Glanceclient currently raises HTTP errors, this is confusing as
it would make someone believe that something happened on the severside
to deny a request. These exceptions could have been raised without the
sever ever returning an error code.

Change-Id: Idd6bc7f5dd85176013997b52053d52052371e453
Closes-bug: 1493859

subject: Move RBD calls to a separate threads
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-25 13:42:38.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_opts.py'], 'message': "Move RBD calls to a separate threads

RBD is a python binding for librados which isn't patched by eventlet.

Making long-running tasks like creating big images blocks eventlet
loop and glance-api service hangs until it finished when
rados_connect_timeout is disabled. It makes glance-api services
unavailable for a while.

This patch moves all rados calls to a separate python thread which
doesn't block eventlet loop.

Change-Id: Ia39c334fba778045efd89e198eee00a32d15d134
"}]
commit_message:
Move RBD calls to a separate threads

RBD is a python binding for librados which isn't patched by eventlet.

Making long-running tasks like creating big images blocks eventlet
loop and glance-api service hangs until it finished when
rados_connect_timeout is disabled. It makes glance-api services
unavailable for a while.

This patch moves all rados calls to a separate python thread which
doesn't block eventlet loop.

Change-Id: Ia39c334fba778045efd89e198eee00a32d15d134

included in the sample glance-api.conf that is shipped with

subject: Kilo backport
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 10:41:41.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/extensions/test_bgpvpn.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/plugin.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/extensions/bgpvpn.py'], 'message': 'Kilo backport

Service_provider in neutron.conf
	In kilo it is not possible to add service
	provider config. Thats why the configuration has
	to be set in neutron.conf

Add namespace to extension
	In kilo an extension for neutron still
	needs a get_namespace method.

Hack around neutrons fixed plugin rules
	The list of allowed services is fixed in kilo.
	This commit adds BGPVPN to the allowed services.

Align unittests to kilo
	bgpvpn_id is given in kwargs not in args.

Change-Id: I0627dbf2c7887ef75d7e71883d7f010f741bf978
'}]
commit_message:
Kilo backport

Service_provider in neutron.conf
	In kilo it is not possible to add service
	provider config. Thats why the configuration has
	to be set in neutron.conf

Add namespace to extension
	In kilo an extension for neutron still
	needs a get_namespace method.

Hack around neutrons fixed plugin rules
	The list of allowed services is fixed in kilo.
	This commit adds BGPVPN to the allowed services.

Align unittests to kilo
	bgpvpn_id is given in kwargs not in args.

Change-Id: I0627dbf2c7887ef75d7e71883d7f010f741bf978

commit_message:
Kilo backport

Service_provider in neutron.conf
	In kilo it is not possible to add service
	provider config. Thats why the configuration has
	to be set in neutron.conf

Add namespace to extension
	In kilo an extension for neutron still
	needs a get_namespace method.

Hack around neutrons fixed plugin rules
	The list of allowed services is fixed in kilo.
	This commit adds BGPVPN to the allowed services.

Align unittests to kilo
	bgpvpn_id is given in kwargs not in args.

Change-Id: I7ea7b78c63d4e2c7ed47862f9febe9e3cd3b9a57

commit_message:
Don't set environment variables in tox.ini

Because of the bug [1] in tox 2.2.1 tox there's a need
to hard-code all environment variables except
the ones which are not set by Fuel CI.

This patch will be reverted as soon as [1] is fixed.

1. https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/tox/issues/285/tox-220-breaks-some-toxini-config-files

Closes-bug: #1517427
Change-Id: I32903c1fd5545ca56410789add7d9c2a8bbacba7

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-13 08:02:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'L3 agent: skip routers notifications if fullsync is true

In case l3 agent is about to fullsync there is no point in processing
routers_updated notifications separately.
This should decrease the (unneeded) load on neutron server at high
scale.

Closes-Bug: #1509295
Change-Id: Ic20b767f34903e9bf14f4616632af3b8698dcebb
'}]
commit_message:
L3 agent: skip routers notifications if fullsync is true

In case l3 agent is about to fullsync there is no point in processing
routers_updated notifications separately.
This should decrease the (unneeded) load on neutron server at high
scale.

Closes-Bug: #1509295
Change-Id: Ic20b767f34903e9bf14f4616632af3b8698dcebb

subject: Kilo backport
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-17 16:02:10.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/extensions/test_bgpvpn.py', 'requirements.txt', 'tools/tox_install.sh', 'test-requirements.txt', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/bgpvpn/bgpvpn.py', 'setup.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/plugin.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/extensions/bgpvpn.py'], 'message': 'Kilo backport

Service_provider in neutron.conf
	In kilo it is not possible to add service
	provider config. Thats why the configuration has
	to be set in neutron.conf

Add namespace to extension
	In kilo an extension for neutron still
	needs a get_namespace method.

Hack around neutrons fixed plugin rules
	The list of allowed services is fixed in kilo.
	This commit adds BGPVPN to the allowed services.

Align requirements to kilo

Deliver bgpvpn_id through network_association dict
	In kilo the parent_id can not be transported
	thats way the bgpvpn_id is included in the
	network_association.

	in neutronclient/v2_0/client.py:
    def extend_create(self, resource_singular, path):
            def _fx(body=None):
	                return self.create_ext(path, body)
			        setattr(self, "create_%s" %
				resource_singular, _fx)

Align unittests to kilo
	bgpvpn_id is given in kwargs not in args.

Change-Id: Ie2043c5d6fe70a53e295c12aba724db49ad157db
'}]
commit_message:
Kilo backport

Service_provider in neutron.conf
	In kilo it is not possible to add service
	provider config. Thats why the configuration has
	to be set in neutron.conf

Add namespace to extension
	In kilo an extension for neutron still
	needs a get_namespace method.

Hack around neutrons fixed plugin rules
	The list of allowed services is fixed in kilo.
	This commit adds BGPVPN to the allowed services.

Align requirements to kilo

Deliver bgpvpn_id through network_association dict
	In kilo the parent_id can not be transported
	thats way the bgpvpn_id is included in the
	network_association.

	in neutronclient/v2_0/client.py:
    def extend_create(self, resource_singular, path):
            def _fx(body=None):
	                return self.create_ext(path, body)
			        setattr(self, "create_%s" %
				resource_singular, _fx)

Align unittests to kilo
	bgpvpn_id is given in kwargs not in args.

Change-Id: Ie2043c5d6fe70a53e295c12aba724db49ad157db

Ceilometer API redirects Alarming requests to Aodh API service.

Closes-bug: #1509885
'}]
commit_message:
telemetry client: accept 307 for create_alarm request

Ceilometer API redirects Alarming requests to Aodh API service.
The return code is not 201 but 307 which is temporary in Liberty cycle
until Ceilometer Alarm is really replaced by Aodh everywhere.

Change-Id: Ide9f6360a6e7468be51003c5a8b051874377c645
Closes-bug: #1509885

commit_message:
Remove vip for rabbitmq

Adjust all the configs to list all the rabbitmq hosts rather than
running rabbitmq through the VIP. This is made possible by clusterer
which has already merged.

Change-Id: I5db48f5f10ec68f4c8863a29bc13984f6845a4f9
Partially-Implements: blueprint rabbitmq-clusterer
(cherry picked from commit 347730cec83796c584162b235f5f18786b20f6ed)

subject: Fix config loading when running the watcher-api
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-23 09:53:04.000000000', 'files': ['watcher/tests/conf_fixture.py', 'watcher/tests/base.py', 'watcher/applier/framework/manager_applier.py', 'watcher/cmd/decisionengine.py', 'watcher/common/service.py', 'watcher/tests/cmd/test_applier.py', 'watcher/cmd/dbmanage.py', 'watcher/api/app.py', 'watcher/cmd/applier.py', 'watcher/tests/cmd/test_db_manage.py', 'watcher/api/config.py', 'watcher/tests/cmd/test_decision_engine.py', 'watcher/tests/cmd/test_api.py', 'watcher/tests/cmd/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Fix config loading when running the watcher-api

This regression was caused when we upgrade the version of olso.
Unfortunately this issue wasn't picked up with the unit tests as
the cmds doesn't have unit tests yet.

Error message: "watcher-api fail with NoSuchOptError: no such option:debug"

This patchset implements unit tests for:

- 'watcher-api' command
- 'watcher-db-manage' command (and sub-command)
- 'watcher-applier' command

Change-Id: I2bea8aee28dec913ebc45f2824bf474f86652642
'}]
commit_message:
Fix config loading when running the watcher-api

This regression was caused when we upgrade the version of olso.
Unfortunately this issue wasn't picked up with the unit tests as
the cmds doesn't have unit tests yet.

Error message: "watcher-api fail with NoSuchOptError: no such option:debug"

This patchset implements unit tests for:

- 'watcher-api' command
- 'watcher-db-manage' command (and sub-command)
- 'watcher-applier' command

Change-Id: I2bea8aee28dec913ebc45f2824bf474f86652642

commit_message:
Create ansible-role-jobs for JJB and zuul

In an effort to reduce duplicate code, we've created an
ansible-role-jobs templaste.  Any new ansible module should use this
template.

We still have a few projects not using this, but will be converted
once their local tox.ini files have been updated.

Change-Id: I20012637ee0fa04ff910c13630b3b3aa5ce230eb
Depends-On: I1815c42f74df237e810332b55c0e890d80ebada9
Depends-On: I83ae3bb426c1a951216e2ca0509d1b5ab5020ecc
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Don't import ironicclient exceptions from openstack.common
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-20 18:16:34.000000000', 'files': ['os_cloud_config/nodes.py', 'os_cloud_config/tests/test_nodes.py'], 'message': "Don't import ironicclient exceptions from openstack.common

Importing from another projects openstack.common is not good, and
now that ironicclient has moved openstack.common to
ironicclient.common it has broken us.  Use ironicclient.exc
instead.

Change-Id: I8b7523f08b39b4f88a64bca6bcf800619e14fcad
"}]
commit_message:
Don't import ironicclient exceptions from openstack.common

Importing from another projects openstack.common is not good, and
now that ironicclient has moved openstack.common to
ironicclient.common it has broken us.  Use ironicclient.exc
instead.

Change-Id: I8b7523f08b39b4f88a64bca6bcf800619e14fcad

to the list of binary dependencies for unit tests in developer
quickstart guide.

subject: get_running_processes: don't list 'kernel' as a pid
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-22 20:53:07.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/utils/build.py'], 'message': "get_running_processes: don't list 'kernel' as a pid

fuser shows some of kernel accesses (mount points, swap files, etc)
using the string 'kernel' as a pid. Ignore such a pseudo-pid to
avoid the spurious errors and noise in the logs.

This CR effectively re-applies #245654 [0] which was merged 
five days ago, but was accidentally reverted by #246575 [1] 
due to some unknown issues during merge to master.
This could easily be seen from commit to master on GitHub [2]
[0] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245654
[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246575
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/fuel-agent/commit/c33563d56172f605e2a2819d11504513f583b51c

Change-Id: Ia0cb7ef41812d854b53e52fbb4e06fd86622fb87
"}]
commit_message:
get_running_processes: don't list 'kernel' as a pid

fuser shows some of kernel accesses (mount points, swap files, etc)
using the string 'kernel' as a pid. Ignore such a pseudo-pid to
avoid the spurious errors and noise in the logs.

This CR effectively re-applies #245654 [0] which was merged 
five days ago, but was accidentally reverted by #246575 [1] 
due to some unknown issues during merge to master.
This could easily be seen from commit to master on GitHub [2]
[0] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245654
[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246575
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/fuel-agent/commit/c33563d56172f605e2a2819d11504513f583b51c

Change-Id: Ia0cb7ef41812d854b53e52fbb4e06fd86622fb87

commit_message:
Import i18n functions for all modules directly

Finish importing of i18n functions from module directly.
It allows to make code shorter and prevent the situation when
translation function is not needed anymore but present in module
global variables(that happens because pep8 doesn't check usage of
module vars).
Also deleted some unused i18 imports from modules.

Change-Id: Ib089b2cbadcaa817ea30de59b6091b1d6d2259a1

commit_message:
Cleanup support-compute.rst usage

The file is only used by admin-guide-cloud, so move it from common to
that directory.
Remove all exclude_patterns that mention support-compute.rst.
Remove XML version of the file since it's unused.

When creating cron-trigger with the following command:

--first-time '2015-11-12 13:28'

commit_message:
Fix cron-trigger's execution with pattern and first time

When creating cron-trigger with the following command:
mistral cron-trigger-create cron1 simple_wf --pattern '*/1 * * * *'
--first-time '2015-11-12 13:28'

The cron-trigger should be executed for every 1 minute over and over
again.

Change-Id: Id6a8c9a747bb56c8bea302cdd86d1e64b99f4eab
Closes-Bug: #1515488

commit_message:
Initial commit

Add structure, unit tests, and template for mistral-specs, creating
a functional specs repository without any approved specs.

Put example.rst in mitaka/approved and mitaka/implemented respectively
to avoid doc build warnings:
"pattern u'specs/mitaka/approved/*' didn't match any documents"

Implements: blueprint mistral-spec-repository
Change-Id: I092ec2f9b1aef9b1bf328658674119eb3cdf3380

commit_message:
Add vhost-user support via ovs capabilities/datapath_type

Adds the ovs 'config' property which returns the contents of the
single row of the Open_vSwitch table. This gives access to certain
OVS capabilities such as datapath_types and iface_types.

Using this information in concert with the datapath_type config
option, vif details are calculated by the OVS mech driver. If
datapath_type == 'netdev' and OVS on the agent host is capable of
supporting dpdkvhostuser, then it is used.

Authored-By: Terry Wilson <twilson@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sean Mooney <sean.k.mooney@intel.com>

Closes-Bug: #1506127
Change-Id: I5047f1d1276e2f52ff02a0cba136e222779d059c

commit_message:
VPN forms help text could be improved

The help text (both tooltips, and descriptive text on the right hand side) for VPN forms (Create, Edit etc.) is very sparse, and we should update it with more information from the VPN docs or API docs.

Fix bug1516603

Change-Id: Ica0efa4aca107ea353213a43159be40865ee549e

commit_message:
Use setup_develop instead of setup_package in plugin.sh

Since all mistral requirements are match with global requirements
it is more correct to use setup_develop function.
Info about this function and difference with setup_package
function can be found here:
https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/inc/python

commit_message:
Reduce vdu2 flavor from  ml.medium to ml.tiny

Some dsvm nodes may has little memory which cannot provide enough
for multiple VDU tests. This patch reduces the vdu2's flavor into
ml.tiny.

Change-Id: Ia7ddc7656d4909e0e977915f70a97baedb782ed9
Closes-bug: 1516204
(cherry picked from commit 3fff7accf2256bcc24d6393c5edecb7bfb0503a3)

commit_message:
Update http_image path to a cirros image file

Current path is for gz file and i changed it to img.
The glance image path is going to be used in new testcases
glance v2 image import supports in import image for http.
We need to set a real image path and not gz.

I run tox -egenconfig
Change-Id: I01703a0e222fbda1ae3ec525936325340fca21ff

subject: Ignore Content-Type from client on multipart-manifest=delete
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-20 19:58:50.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/slo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py'], 'message': "Ignore Content-Type from client on multipart-manifest=delete

Otherwise, if a client includes something like:

    Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

...we won't delete anything, and instead send back:

    Number Deleted: 0
    Number Not Found: 0
    Response Body:
    Response Status: 406 Not Acceptable
    Errors:

...despite the fact that we're managing the iterator, so we know it's
acceptable.

Change-Id: I791c7bda1d9df830d8dacd3783c2393db5a9ac09
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore Content-Type from client on multipart-manifest=delete

Otherwise, if a client includes something like:

    Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

...we won't delete anything, and instead send back:

    Number Deleted: 0
    Number Not Found: 0
    Response Body:
    Response Status: 406 Not Acceptable
    Errors:

...despite the fact that we're managing the iterator, so we know it's
acceptable.

Change-Id: I791c7bda1d9df830d8dacd3783c2393db5a9ac09

subject: Fix error when listing stacks
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-19 21:56:07.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/osc/v1/stack.py', 'heatclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_stack.py'], 'message': 'Fix error when listing stacks

Previously the stack list command would error out if any stacks were

stack object, rather than grabbing its attributes. This change switches
the action code to use the proper utility for a resource instead of

Change-Id: Ia6b73d5c1ba7f7e3d7bc5493167da81062102b42
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Fix error when listing stacks

Previously the stack list command would error out if any stacks were
present. This was due to the action code attempting to index on a
stack object, rather than grabbing its attributes. This change switches
the action code to use the proper utility for a resource instead of
a dict.

Change-Id: Ia6b73d5c1ba7f7e3d7bc5493167da81062102b42
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient
